content.2: And his disciples asked him, saying, Master, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?
content.4: I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day: the night cometh, when no man can work.
content.5: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.
content.6: When he had thus spoken, he spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and he anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay,
content.8: The neighbours therefore, and they which before had seen him that he was blind, said, Is not this he that sat and begged?
content.9: Some said, This is he: others
content.10: Therefore said they unto him, How were thine eyes opened?
content.11: He answered and said, A man that is called Jesus made clay, and anointed mine eyes, and said unto me, Go to the pool of Siloam, and wash: and I went and washed, and I received sight.
content.12: Then said they unto him, Where is he? He said, I know not.
content.13: They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind.
content.14: And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay, and opened his eyes.
content.15: Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. He said unto them, He put clay upon mine eyes, and I washed, and do see.
content.16: Therefore said some of the Pharisees, This man is not of God, because he keepeth not the sabbath day. Others said, How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles? And there was a division among them.
content.17: They say unto the blind man again, What sayest thou of him, that he hath opened thine eyes? He said, He is a prophet.
content.18: But the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind, and received his sight, until they called the parents of him that had received his sight.
content.19: And they asked them, saying, Is this your son, who ye say was born blind? how then doth he now see?
content.20: His parents answered them and said, We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind:
content.21: But by what means he now seeth, we know not; or who hath opened his eyes, we know not: he is of age; ask him: he shall speak for himself.
content.23: Therefore said his parents, He is of age; ask him.
content.24: Then again called they the man that was blind, and said unto him, Give God the praise: we know that this man is a sinner.
content.25: He answered and said, Whether he be a sinner
content.26: Then said they to him again, What did he to thee? how opened he thine eyes?
content.27: He answered them, I have told you already, and ye did not hear: wherefore would ye hear
content.28: Then they reviled him, and said, Thou art his disciple; but we are Moses’ disciples.
content.29: We know that God spake unto Moses:
content.30: The man answered and said unto them, Why herein is a marvellous thing, that ye know not from whence he is, and
content.31: Now we know that God heareth not sinners: but if any man be a worshipper of God, and doeth his will, him he heareth.
content.32: Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind.
content.33: If this man were not of God, he could do nothing.
content.34: They answered and said unto him, Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us? And they cast him out.
content.35: Jesus heard that they had cast him out; and when he had found him, he said unto him,
content.36: He answered and said, Who is he, Lord, that I might believe on him?
content.38: And he said, Lord, I believe. And he worshipped him.
